projects.title: Love Awards 2015 and 'Matters of Love: The Show'
projects.description:
For Love Matters Africa we helped launch the Love Matters Music Awards: the first music awards in Kenya dedicated to providing young people the chance to produce songs on themes related to pleasure and sexuality.

Working in partnership with the Institute of Development Studies (IDS), as well as East African record label Penya, the project brought together online activities and offline realities, culminating in a live multimedia final: 'Matters of Love: The Show', performed in Nairobi on December 5th.

"During the course of the project, participants from the Penya’s Sauti Academy in Nairobi were coached by international visual artist Iris Honderdos and music producer Arno Peeters (who also made the script for the show), alongside experts on gender and sexuality from IDS and Love Matters."

projects.title: "Visualizing With Identity" Phase 2: The Benet in Uganda
projects.description:
Based on the diverse perspectives and voices of the Benet People, we created a multidimensional portrayal of Benet culture with the help of Benet elderly, women and children to show its precious heritage and its fragile contemporary existence.
The installation was launched in Kapchorwa and was exhibited in Kampala between Jan. 18th and 31st, 2013.

profile_positions.description:
I am an autodidact composer: in 1983 I started my first musical experiments with modified tape decks, hacked electronic toys and hifi-equipment. 

Around 1986 I was able to professionalize my technical skills and study electronic composition at the then legendary Center for Electronic Music (CEM-Studio).
In 1989 I was one of the techno-pioneers in the Netherlands, working under names as Voltage Control, Spasms, The Implant and in collaborations like Random XS and Urban Electro.

In the years that followed, I made several records and CD's in the emerging electronic dance-scene but, disappointed by the many conventions back than, I turned away and fled into more experimental music of which some was released on the German Mille Plateaux label.
In 1996 I created “AeroSon”, a 40' soundscape as the Dutch admission to the International Rostrum for Electro-Acoustic Music (IREM). It won me the first prize in the category ‘Composers Under 30”.

I've always showed interest with almost any part of sound, which has lead to a rather diverse number of activities. I'm a freelance radio-producer and editor with the Dutch National Radio, teach editing,-and recording techniques in various settings and I do both commercial,- and non-profit productions, ranging from remixes, leaders and advertising to experimental music and sound design. From time to time I'm involved in recording on location as well: for film/TV, or DVD-productions. I assemble, edit and mix for broadcast, film and games on a regular basis and specialize in surround sound and audio art. 
Together with partner and artist Iris Honderdos, I completed several installations worldwide.

Due to my widespread experience in the area of sound and music, festivals and organizations sometimes acquire my help as consultant for audiovisual solutions or as an aid in setting up the program.
profile_positions.title: Composer and soundartist

profile_positions.description: Tired of having to depend on others, I started my own company and studio back in 1996. Ever since, my company has been expanding in all directions in the field of working with sound: games, multimedia, editing, authoring, restoration, mastering in stereo and surround. Most clients are Dutch Public Broadcasters like NTR, VPRO, NPO and companies like U-Trax Multimedia (localization), BosBros (TV), Fiep Westendorp (animation) and artists like Speedy J, Marie Jo LaFontaine, Vaardigheid, Drifter.
profile_positions.title: Owner

profile_positions.description:
Iris Honderdos (film, photography, installations) and Arno Peeters (multimedia and sound) are ‘community based’ artists and they have a worldwide experience in this field.

Since 2003 they live and work together and collaborated on projects in the Czech Republic with former miners and their wives, Ukraine during the Orange Revolution and worked extensively in North-Vietnam with HIV infected women and female ex-drug users. More recent projects took them to Armenia, Friesland, Liberia, Bulgaria, Norway and Peru.

In their method of working they cannot know upfront what they will create, since they need to home in on the emotions of the community they want to work with.After a process of research and meditation on a subject, sketching and modeling, the actual work on the art itself can begin.It results mostly in an installation, accompanied by sound or video and is presented to the audience during a performance or concert; it is a gift to the community.
Their approach proofed to be very suitable for addressing complex or sensitive issues within local communities. Therefore they have been contracted by several NGOs. They have worked for the Medical Committee Netherlands Vietnam, for Cordaid in Sierra Leone, the Royal Tropical Institute in Meghalaya and Uganda and for The Institute of Development Studies in Kenya.

profile_positions.description:
Dialogue-recording, editing , sounddesign and mix for an animation-series based on the drawings of the (in The Netherlands) legendary Fiep Westendorp. At Cinekid, the series won the Kinderkast Jury Prize in 2010 and 2011, was again nominated in 2012 and won for a third time in 2013.
In 2014 "The Great Adventure" was released in cinemas: the first full length animation movie in The Netherlands for decades. It got stellar ratings throughout, was nominated for Cinekid 2014 and won several international prizes.

profile_positions.company: MCNV - For health and development in South East Asia
profile_positions.description:
Together with Iris Honderdos and in admission of the Medical Committee Netherlands Vietnam, we have given creative communication courses for women in,- and affected by HIV/Aids all over North Vietnam: Thaí Nguyên, Dai Tu, Hanoi, Cao Bang, Halong and most recently in Ha Giang (2009). Preferably we follow such 3-day courses by the joint creation of an artwork and/or a public performance trying to tackle common misconceptions and discrimination.
Since 2008 we have been training Vietnamese peers to give our training, which has been published in a manual (English and Vietnamese) and which has been spread to all NGO's working in this field in Vietnam.
